result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Gondek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Remain living w/parents.  Take all medications in the dosages precribed and attend all doctor appointments.

timeConds.notes: w/huber - STAYED for rule violations - if a violation the deft is to come back to the court for the imposing of the jail time.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas J. Gondek in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Nothing from the victim.

Court orders
12 months probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Remain living w/parents
Take all medications is dosages prescribed and attend all doctor appt
5 days jail - STAYED for rule violations - if a violation the deft is to come back to the court for the imposing of the jail time.

Defendant Thomas J. Gondek in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense are not challenging the findings of Dr Galli.  Court questions the deft as to reviewing the report.  Court rules in regards to the report of Dr Galli.  Concludes that the deft is competent to proceed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Gondek in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called Appearances given.  Defense attorney addresses the court that there is an appointment setup with Dr Galli on January 11, 2016 in the morning.  Rescheduled  Competency hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Thomas J. Gondek in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest.    Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court reviewed the competency file on the deft.  The court wishes to order a competency review before doing sentencing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Report to the LIncoln County Jail for booking if not already completed.  No contact w/Kemo Piercings
Report to the LIncoln County Jail for booking if not already completed.  No contact w/ Kemo Piercings

Defendant, Thomas J. Gondek appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
